meanings.definition: The act of deploying forces or resources in response to an enemy's deployment.
meanings.sent1: The counterdeployment of troops was necessary to defend our borders.
meanings.sent2: The general ordered a counterdeployment of soldiers to match the enemy's movements.
meanings.sent3: The counterdeployment of snacks at the party quickly disappeared.
meanings.sent4: Her quick counterdeployment of arguments left him speechless.
meanings.sent5: The counterdeployment of firefighters saved the town from the spreading fire.

meanings.definition: A military strategy involving the positioning of troops or equipment to counteract an opponent's movements.
meanings.sent1: The success of the counterdeployment relied on precise planning.
meanings.sent2: The commander's counterdeployment effectively halted the enemy's advance.
meanings.sent3: The counterdeployment of umbrellas during the sunny day drew some puzzled looks.
meanings.sent4: Her strategic counterdeployment of pawns surprised her opponent in the game.
meanings.sent5: The counterdeployment of barriers prevented the enemy from crossing the river.
